texts.label: text
texts.orig: SUBJECT: Final Results of Sanctionable Pended Encounters September 2018
texts.text: SUBJECT: Final Results of Sanctionable Pended Encounters September 2018

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Dear Ms. Oestreich:
texts.text: Dear Ms. Oestreich:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This attached information will provide the final aged pended encounter sanctions for the quarter ending September 2018. According to the Contract (YHI4-0001-02), Banner University Family Care (UFC) is required to resolve all pended encounters within 120 calendar days of the processing date. If this requirement is not met, the Contractor is subject to sanctions.
texts.text: This attached information will provide the final aged pended encounter sanctions for the quarter ending September 2018. According to the Contract (YHI4-0001-02), Banner University Family Care (UFC) is required to resolve all pended encounters within 120 calendar days of the processing date. If this requirement is not met, the Contractor is subject to sanctions.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The exception to the above is when the pended encounter is due to an Arizona Health Care Cost Containment System (AHCCCS) error. AHCCCS error is defined as a pended encounter, which AHCCCS acknowledges to be the result of its own error, and requires a change to the system programming, an update to the database reference table, or further research by AHCCCS. Contractors must notify AHCCCS, in writing that the resolution of a pended encounter depends on AHCCCS instead of the Contractor. Pended encounters do not qualify as AHCCCS error if AHCCCS reviews the Contractor's notification and asks the Contractor to research the issue and provide additional substantiating documentation, or if AHCCCS disagrees with the Contractor's claims of AHCCCS error.
texts.text: The exception to the above is when the pended encounter is due to an Arizona Health Care Cost Containment System (AHCCCS) error. AHCCCS error is defined as a pended encounter, which AHCCCS acknowledges to be the result of its own error, and requires a change to the system programming, an update to the database reference table, or further research by AHCCCS. Contractors must notify AHCCCS, in writing that the resolution of a pended encounter depends on AHCCCS instead of the Contractor. Pended encounters do not qualify as AHCCCS error if AHCCCS reviews the Contractor's notification and asks the Contractor to research the issue and provide additional substantiating documentation, or if AHCCCS disagrees with the Contractor's claims of AHCCCS error.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: AHCCCS distributed the preliminary sanction results, including a summary of encounters excluded from sanctions as AHCCCS error, on January 24, 2019. The Contractor was provided an opportunity to review the preliminary results, and challenge those encounters believed to be sanctioned in error. The Contractor's submitted mitigation was considered, and when appropriate, the mitigated encounters were removed from the final sanctionable encounters. The preliminary sanctionable number of pendec encounters for UFC was 27,149 and the final sanction number pended encounters for this quarter is
texts.text: AHCCCS distributed the preliminary sanction results, including a summary of encounters excluded from sanctions as AHCCCS error, on January 24, 2019. The Contractor was provided an opportunity to review the preliminary results, and challenge those encounters believed to be sanctioned in error. The Contractor's submitted mitigation was considered, and when appropriate, the mitigated encounters were removed from the final sanctionable encounters. The preliminary sanctionable number of pendec encounters for UFC was 27,149 and the final sanction number pended encounters for this quarter is

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Per the terms of the Contract, sanctions are not the Administration's exclusive remedy. In particular and result of your non-compliance with the Contract, the Administration will seek compensation from you for
texts.text: Per the terms of the Contract, sanctions are not the Administration's exclusive remedy. In particular and result of your non-compliance with the Contract, the Administration will seek compensation from you for

texts.label: text

texts.text: without limiting possible future actions, if any legal action is brought against the Administration as the any damages arising from such legal action including but not limited to the Administration's cost of

texts.text: representation as well as the cost of any attorneys' fees and costs payable to the party bringing the action.
